data: English | France | Paris | Madeleine | Faubourg Montmartre | Channel | French | British

The English, whose knowledge of France consists in a fair acquaintance of that part of Paris lying between the Madeleine and the Faubourg Montmartre, affirm that family life is unknown on our side of the Channel, putting forward as proof the fact that the French language cannot boast of possessing the word _home_, that appeals so strongly to the British heart.
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
